text:
I get the following exception in the JSVGScrollPane if the viewBox attribute of
the svg element is not specified.

java.lang.NullPointerException
org.apache.batik.swing.JSVGScrollPane.checkAndSetViewBoxRect(Unknown Source)
org.apache.batik.swing.JSVGScrollPane.resizeScrollBars(Unknown Source)
org.apache.batik.swing.JSVGScrollPane$ScrollListener.componentResized(Unknown
Source)
java.awt.Component.processComponentEvent(Component.java:5314)
java.awt.Component.processEvent(Component.java:5268)
java.awt.Container.processEvent(Container.java:1966)
java.awt.Component.dispatchEventImpl(Component.java:3955)
java.awt.Container.dispatchEventImpl(Container.java:2024)
java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent(Component.java:3803)
java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(EventQueue.java:463)
java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForHierarchy(EventDispatchThread.java:234)
java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(EventDispatchThread.java:163)
java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:157)
java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:149)
java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(EventDispatchThread.java:110)

A simple null check fixes the problem

        float[] rect = ViewBox.parseViewBoxAttribute(el, viewBoxStr);
+       if (rect == null) return;
creator: richard.zschech@cqrdata.com
